column1: Prolactin is a hormone released by the pituitary gland.
The prolactin test measures the amount of prolactin in the blood.
Prolactin is a hormone released by the pituitary gland. that stimulates breast development and milk production in women.

Prolactin is usually measured when checking for pituitary tumors and the cause of: - Breast milk production that is not related to childbirth (galactorrhea) - Decreased sex drive (libido) in men and women - Erection problems in men - Not able to get pregnant (infertility) - Irregular or no menstrual periods (amenorrhea)
